Name: Akitio Station
Sky Visibility: Good to north, some fully grown trees to north east.

Name: Whangaparaoa No 3
Sky Visibility: Three MetService masts at distances of 13 metres to > 50 metres, with elevations up to 21 degrees above horizon.

Name: Avalon Sound Stage
Sky Visibility: Excellent, antenna mounted on top of sound stage.

Name: Black Hill Station
Sky Visibility: GPS site is on the shoulder of a broad hill. The hilltop obstructs the skyview up to 8 deg at a bearing of 008 true North. This location was chosen to allow for a combined site build.

Name: Battery Hill
Sky Visibility: Excellent, no obstructions to the North. 4m quad beacon on same hilltop.

Name: Chatham Island
Sky Visibility: MetService buildings and several masts at distances of 25 metres to >50 metres, with elevations up to 15 degrees above horizon.

Name: Chatham Island North
Sky Visibility: good. minor obstrustion at: -bearing 190 degrees of 5-10 degrees (quarry with seismic vault).

Name: Carnagh Station
Sky Visibility: Good, trees create a 3-5 degree obstruction between 210 and 220 degrees from magnetic north.

Name: Faleolo
Sky Visibility: unknown; Antenna is fixed to a steel post ~ 2m high.

Name: Frasertown
Sky Visibility: Excellent, hills are 5 degree obstruction from ~230-274 true (approx southwest).

Name: Glen Orkney Station
Sky Visibility: good. some minor obstructions to the SE related to the Inland Kaikoura Range

Name: Greenbank
Sky Visibility: Excellent, no obstructions to the north. Short, bulky totara tree growing down bank to the south creates an 8 degree angle obsruction at approx 120 true bearing.

Name: Grange Hill
Sky Visibility: Sky view clear with no obstructions. Mt Ruapehu is visible in the distance. Open view of the Manuwatu Plains, Palmerston North and northern Tararuas.

Name: Gunn Ridge
Sky Visibility: Uncertain due to cloud cover during reconnaissance but map suggests excellent view in northern sky. Obstructions 12 to 13 degrees in the southwest.

Name: Haast
Sky Visibility: Obstruction up 20 degrees between 40 and 110 degrees magnetic, otherwise no obstruction above 10 degrees.

Name: Hanmer Basin
Sky Visibility: Good - some pine trees in ~east creating 23 degree obstruction

Name: Holdsworth Station
Sky Visibility: Good. Up to 16 degrees of obstruction from hill due south, but this does not block any satellites.

Name: Kapiti
Sky Visibility: 15 degrees elevation obstruction between NNE and ENE, elswhere less than 5 degrees.

Name: Kaweka Forest
Sky Visibility: good, pine trees to the north west, less than 12 deg.

Name: Kooro
Sky Visibility: Good. Mature pine trees at 3-5 degrees inclination between 265 and 280 degrees from true north.

Name: Moutere No.3
Sky Visibility: Clear to the north and east. Macrocarpas on hill behind site create sky view obstruction of maximum 20 deg at bearing 210 degrees from true north and between 12 and 8 deg from bearing 155 to 255.

Name: Tangoio No 2
Sky Visibility: Excellent. Radio path should go directly to Hastings District Council.

Name: Lake Taylor
Sky Visibility: No obstruction above 07 degrees in the northern quadrants, upto 16 degrees in the southern quadrants.

Name: Mount Lookout
Sky Visibility: good. though Lookout Mountain peak is to the NE, with a maximum elevation of 20 degrees.

Name: Mahoenui
Sky Visibility: A hill to the east obscures skyview to 14 degrees, elsewhere there are no obstructions above 10 degrees elevation.

Name: Mavora Lakes
Sky Visibility: No obstruction above 07 degrees in the northern quadrants, increasing to 20 degrees in the southern quadrants

Name: Methven
Sky Visibility: Cloud cover made it impossible to see mountains to the west, calculations show < 10 degrees.

Name: Makino Road
Sky Visibility: Obstructions to East up to 12 degrees formed by Mokai Patea Range.

Name: McQueens Valley
Sky Visibility: No obstructions above 10 degrees elevation. Tree/gorse cutting may be required in future

Name: Mount Blewitt No. 2
Sky Visibility: Excellent, open paddock with no obstructions

Name: Mt. Quoin
Sky Visibility: All less than 4 degrees in all directions.

Name: Niue Meteorological Station
Sky Visibility: Good. Meterological service building is about 50m away to the North. There are also large radio masts to the North-east and West of the monument, but these are quite distant.

Name: North Range Road
Sky Visibility: Skyview is obstructed by windturbines between bearings of 260 and 340 (true) at angles of between 6 and 10 degrees. The wind turbines are about 2 kilometers from the proposed site.

Name: Opotiki
Sky Visibility: suitable visibility Inc. Dec. 7 137 tree 4 160-140 5 125-110 trees 4 355 tree

Name: Tuapaka Z
Sky Visibility: Good; Otaki and Kapiti Island are in clear line of sight, Levin also through gap in hills. Hills to the north east create 4?-6? obstructions between 005? and 140? from true north.

Name: Paritu Road
Sky Visibility: Good, sky clear to the north. Half grown pine plantation across the road to the west and north west.

Name: Paruwai
Sky Visibility: 20 degrees elevation obstruction between WSW and WNW, elswhere < 5 degrees

Name: Parikino
Sky Visibility: Excellent, all obstructions less than 4 degrees.

Name: Pukenui
Sky Visibility: Good skyview above 6 degrees to W, NW and SW, elsewhere above less than 5 degrees.

Name: Puketoi
Sky Visibility: Skyview good above 6 degrees to NNE, 8 degrees to NNW, 5 degrees to N. Elsewhere good above less than 5 degrees.

Name: Arahi
Sky Visibility: 5-8 degrees sky view obstructions from pine trees on skyline at 280-295 degrees from true north

Name: Richmond Range
Sky Visibility: Excellent. The two biggest peaks are NE and SW and 2? above horizon

Name: Ardelve
Sky Visibility: Wind break trees about 6 degrees to the south (195-222) and trees/mountains at 4 degrees to the west (263-334). Otherwise unobstructed above 1-2 degrees

Name: Allen Road
Sky Visibility: Max obstruction 5deg to north, 3deg to east, 0deg to west, 7deg to south.

Name: Cookson Road
Sky Visibility: No restrictions in any direction, although site has been abandoned due to the planting of trees in the immediate and surrounding area. DBM and fence remain in place but access may become impossible.

Name: Hawthornden Drive
Sky Visibility: horizon to the East is 10 degrees.

Name: Handcock Road
Sky Visibility: clear to north, east and south. Horizon at 9deg to west.

Name: Lichenstein Road
Sky Visibility: Excellent to the north; small shed and water tank directly to the southeast.

Name: Matata
Sky Visibility: Max obstruction 8 deg to the south. Trig 6851 is ~4m SSW of monument

Name: Rotoehu
Sky Visibility: obscured to 10deg to south, clear at all other directions

Name: Utuhina
Sky Visibility: no restictions to the N, NW, W and NE,E. 10-15 degrees to the SW, S, SE

Name: White Island Crater Floor
Sky Visibility: The crater rim is 250m to the north, 60m high. Not ideal but this is the best sky view possible for a site on the crater floor.

Name: Ripia
Sky Visibility: No obstruction above 10 degrees elevation except for VSAT hut (less than 15 degrees)

Name: Seddon
Sky Visibility: Clear skyview 000 360 from 2? elevation - except row of trees at 074 to 097 block view from 3? to 5?. Couldn't see hilltops at ~256 because of low cloud, unlikely to be > 5? elevation

Name: Shannon Station
Sky Visibility: good. 5 degree obstruction to the north

Name: Taupo Airport
Sky Visibility: Clear above 10 degrees elevation with the exception of a meteorological mast six metres Northeast. Mast dimensions: 8 metre high, 70mm diameter

Name: Horomatangi Reef
Sky Visibility: 2m pole ~ 1m to south of mark, otherwise no obstructions.

Name: Ouaha Hills
Sky Visibility: clear all round except 7 deg hill at SE. Masts to 5m at 070mag

Name: Rangitukua
Sky Visibility: Clear to the N, E and W. obstructed to the Sth by hill to 18deg.

Name: Whakaroa
Sky Visibility: Obscured to <10deg to northeast. Clear at all other directions.

Name: Taihape
Sky Visibility: Good, ridge to the north causes obstructions of 5-6 degrees between bearings of 300 and 280 degrees from grid north.

Name: Terawhiti
Sky Visibility: Good: single obstruction of 5 degrees inclination at 170 degrees (magnetic north).

Name: Te Uri
Sky Visibility: Very good (max 5 degrees)except 3 power poles in western sky (John Beavan has approved site). Pole 1 (at 249T) is 7 degrees tall, pole 2 (at 278T) is 7 degrees tall and pole 3 (at 303T) is 2 degrees.

Name: Port Underwood
Sky Visibility: Obstructions: 342-166 = <4 degrees, punctuated by trees at 342 (7 deg), 022 (8 deg), 057 (6 deg), and 067 (11 deg) 166-229 = ~ 10 degrees, building to 20 229-302=avg 12 deg 302-342=<6 deg

Name: Utiku Borehole 2
Sky Visibility: sky visible from about 45 deg above horizon, may clear more if needed

Name: Utiku Borehole 3
Sky Visibility: Sky visible from about 45 deg above horizon, may clear more trees if needed

Name: Utiku Borehole 4
Sky Visibility: Sky visible from about 45 deg above horizon. May clear more trees if needed.

Name: Karewarewa
Sky Visibility: Excellent to north. Obsecured to approx 15deg to south by Mt Tongariro

Name: Ngauruhoe
Sky Visibility: Large rock about 1m North and 0.3 m below the antenna. Distance between the closest part of the cabinet and solar panels to the antenna is 3.6m, with the cabinet to the South East of the GPS antenna.

Name: Te Maari 2
Sky Visibility: clear to the north, rigde behind to south

Name: Waihua
Sky Visibility: Cabbage trees obstruction - the coordinates of the site should be tweaked in a future visit to place these trees due south.

Name: Wanganui
Sky Visibility: No obstruction above 10 degrees elevation (Water Tank 2.5m high, 5.0m South)

Name: Waipukurau
Sky Visibility: Good In the second half of 2013 a deer fence was added by the landowner (see pics). It has some large posts that may impact sky view.

Name: Wairau Valley
Sky Visibility: Excellent. 000? - 360? everything visible 3? 4? above the horizon.

Name: Wairarapa
Sky Visibility: good, large pines to W-SW will be removed in near future. house at ENE
